summary: A series of emails from August 10, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) and other officials discussing the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The emails reveal confusion, hoax calls to Epstein's associates, coordination issues with the Bureau of Prisons (BOP), and the initiation of investigations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the emails; reported to have died by apparent suicide at MCC, with his body at the hospital and an autopsy being conducted.

connections.description: GS is leading the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's death and aftermath
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is reported to have died by an apparent suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), was taken to a hospital, and an autopsy is being conducted. Confusion and hoax calls follow.

events.title: Hoax call about body retrieval
events.description: An individual named (phonetic) claiming to be an MCC investigator calls a person close to Epstein, stating his body is ready for pickup at the hospital, prompting concerns about misinformation.

events.title: BOP press release issuance
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons issues a public press release about Epstein's death before providing basic information to the U.S. Attorney's Office, causing frustration and coordination issues.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York 10007
Hospital (unspecified, where Epstein's body was taken)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was reported dead on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center from an apparent suicide, with an autopsy being conducted.
Hoax calls were made to Epstein's associates, including one from an individual claiming to be an MCC investigator instructing them to pick up Epstein's body from the hospital.
The Bureau of Prisons (BOP) issued a public press release about Epstein's death before coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office, leading to significant frustration and information gaps.
Investigations by the FBI and DOJ-OIG into Epstein's death were referenced, with a need to establish points of contact for these probes.
Defense counsel for Epstein reported receiving calls from people claiming to have information relevant to his death, highlighting the chaotic flow of information.
